# Delivery Services of Laboratory Specimens – Thompson, Manitoba

## Overview

The Department of Indigenous Services Canada, First Nations and Inuit Health Branch (FNIHB), is seeking a contractor to provide delivery services for laboratory specimens in Thompson, Manitoba. The contract will commence on November 1, 2022, and is valid for two (2) years, with an optional one (1) year extension.

## Services Required

The contractor must pick up coolers containing laboratory specimens twice daily from Thompson Airport and ensure same-day delivery to Thompson General Hospital. Empty coolers and corresponding paperwork must be collected once daily and transported to Thompson Airport.

## Security Requirements

This contract involves security requirements. Bidders should refer to the [Contract Security Program](https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/introduction-eng.html) of Public Works and Government Services Canada for additional information.

## Key Dates

* Tender closing date: September 19, 2022, 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)
* Contract commencement date: November 1, 2022
* Contract expiry date: October 31, 2024 (with an optional one-year extension)

## Purchaser Information

* Procuring Entity: Indigenous Services Canada
* Procurement Category: [SRV](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/fm/en PROCUREMENT SERVICES PROCUREMENT SERVICES)
* Trade Agreements: Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and others
